newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Guam details prices for 1996-97 fuel oil, diesel.
newsitem.headline: Guam details prices for 1996-97 fuel oil, diesel.

text.p: Guam Power Authority (GPA) on Wednesday said it awarded an annual term purchase contract for fuel oil to Daxin Petroleum Pte Ltd, after talks with two other companies fell through.

Daxin was awarded the contract after it offered 2.0 percent sulphur fuel oil at $2.23 per barrel over spot quotes of Singapore's 3.5-percent sulphur grade fuel oil, on a cost-and-freight (c-and-f) basis, said GPA general manager Randy Wiegand.
The 1.19-percent sulphur fuel oil was awarded to Daxin at $3.15-per-barrel premium over Singapore's spot quotes for 3.5-percent sulphur grade, c-and-f, he said.
The contract runs August 1, 1996 to July 30, 1997 and a conversion factor of 6.0 barrels per tonne was used for pricing the fuel oil, he said.

Wiegand said a regional company, which had made the lowest offer, was initially awarded the contract. It delivered two 280,000-barrel cargoes in June and July but the deal was terminated mid-July because the company could not give "a satisfactory performance bond."
GPA approached British Petroleum & Co Plc, which had made the second best offer, but a deal was not concluded, prompting GPA to approach Daxin that had made the third best offer.

GPA recently also concluded five contracts to purchase 0.5-percent sulphur diesel from the local affiliates of Royal/Dutch Shell and Mobil Corp for deliveries between October 1, 1996 and September 30, 1997, he said.

The prices of the two biggest contracts, which were 15 million gallons (358,000) each, were at a premium of 7.94 cents per gallon to Singapore spot quotes fob, and 7.63 cents per gallon premium to Singapore spot quotes, fob.
